page.syntax: C ui_get_table(C title[,C type [,C default [,L more [,L listbox [,L absolute_path ]]]]])

argument.name: title
argument.description: The title of the dialog box.

argument.name: type
argument.description: Optional. What type of table to display in the list. Default = "Both"

argument.name: default
argument.description:
Optional. Default = no selection.
The default table or set.

item.name: .T. = displays at the top of the list
.F. = display as Drop down list box
.T. = return absolute path, filename, and file extension.

page.description: Prompt for table and/or set. Display choices from current database. Type is "table","set" or "both".
page.discussion: The UI_GET_TABLE() function prompts for table and/or set. Displays choices from current database.
page.example: dim a as C a = ui_get_table("Tables", "Table", "Customer", .t., .t., .t.) ? a ? "c:\databases\expressions test\customer.dbf"
